basis

Class BotGameInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • basis.BotGameInfo
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AntBotGameInfo

    public class BotGameInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class holds informations about the game a bot is currently playing. It's mainly used to manage the mechanics of the reception of game actions but it also contains the game score of a bot, if used. Overloading this class is strongly recommended if you want to add bot infos that are specific to the game you implement.
    Author:
    Nicolas

    • Field Detail

      • botId

        private int botId
        The identifier specific to the bot for this game. Can be used to reference the bot in replay data or other stuff.

      • played

        private boolean played
        Whether the bot has played for the current round. If the bot sends a "gameactions" whereas this boolean is set to true, then the bot will receive a "Already played for this round" error message. When all the bots have played for the current round, the game the continue to the next round. It means it does not have to wait for the response delay to finish.
        See Also:
        Documentation/protocol/gameactions.html

      • gamestateTimestampMs

        private long gamestateTimestampMs
        The timestamp of the sending of the current game state. (in milliseconds) Should be tested when the server receives a "gameactions" message from this bot. If the delay is exceeded, then the server sends a "gamemute" message to the bot so the bot cannot play until the end of the game.

      • muted

        private boolean muted
        Whether the bot was muted in its game.

      • gameScore

        private int gameScore
        The current game score of the bot.

        public boolean hasPlayed()
        Gets whether the bot has played for the current round.
        Returns:
        true if the bot has already played for this round, false otherwise.
